node.description:
Special Report: Medical Cannabis Latin America 2022 is an examination, through the words of sector leaders, of the current state of this growing industry across Latin America as progressive regulatory landscapes emerge and companies look to gain an early foothold.

In this 84-page edition, which also features news and analysis, we cover everything from doing business in the sector, regulatory and legal issues, medical and patient access, and other services.

Here is just a selection of the interviews contained:

Steve DeAngelo, Industry Expert & Co-founder, Harborside Inc.
Rodrigo Arcila Gómez, President, Colombian Association of Cannabis Industries (Asocolcanna)
Luis Merchán, President & CEO, Flora Growth Corp.
Adriana Herrera, CEO, Earth’s Healing Colombia (EHCOL)
Keila Santos, Founder, Revivid Brasil
Wilson Ruiz, Outgoing Minister of Justice and Law, Colombia
Ana Karina Ramírez Gómez, Executive Director, ECUADOR'S National Agency for Regulation, Control, and Sanitary Surveillance (ARCSA)
Ximena Garzón, Minister of Public Health, Ecuador
Robert Hoban, President, Gateway Proven Strategies (GPS)
Claudia Della Mora, Managing Director & Co-Founder, Black Legend Capital (BLC)

About The Business Year
The Business Year is a global media group that has been providing investors, businesses, and governments with first-hand insights into the world's most dynamic markets for over a decade. We conduct hundreds of interviews a week with top decision makers in the Middle East, Latin America, Central and Southeast Asia, Africa, and Europe. Our content is available in printed reports and across an array of digital platforms.

While The Business Year has published research on the Spanish economy at large and carried out a more focused analysis on the local Barcelona economy, this is the first time we have shone such an intense spotlight on Mallorca, the largest of Spain’s Balearic Islands. This publication features interviews with over 90 of the island’s top business figures from a diverse range of sectors, including sustainability and digitalization, tourism and hospitality, sports, ports and marinas, construction and architecture, real estate and design, and mobility, with a special focus on the “Made in Mallorca” brand.

With this 156-page publication, discover more about how one of the most popular tourism destinations in Europe is reinventing itself after COVID-19, and why international investment funds are betting on Mallorca.

Here is just a selection of the interviews contained:

Andreu Serra, Mallorcan Minister of Tourism and Sports & President, Fundació Mallorca Turisme
Carmen Planas, President, Confederation of Business Associations of the Balearic Islands (CAEB) 
Antoni Mercant Morató, President, Chamber of Commerce of Mallorca 
José Hila, Mayor, Palma 
Francisco Albertí, Partner, Corporate Finance, Hotel Transactions, KPMG Baleares
Antoni Ballester Gornals, CEO, Estel Ingeniería y Obras 
Rafael Guinea Mairlot, Managing Director, Tirme 
Bernat Bonnin Pons-Estel, President, ROBOT 
Sabina Fluxá, Vice Chairman & CEO, Iberostar Group
Carmen Riu, CEO, RIU Hotels & Resorts
Gabriel Escarrer, Executive Vice Chairman & CEO, Meliá Hotels International 
Bernardino Jaume Mulet, President, Balearic Federation of Golf 
Jose María Campuzano, CEO, IPM Group (STP Shipyard Palma)
Eduardo López, Founder, Alibaz 
Hans Lenz, Managing Director, Engel & Völkers Mallorca Southwest & President, Mallorca Preservation Foundation 
Biel Huguet, Director, Huguet

The publication also features a range of articles and analysis, including:

Nou Llevant
ParcBIT
Puerto Portals
Tourism competitiveness
Rural tourism
Golf
Regattas and sailing
ESG in construction
Mallorca Design District
Local culinary produce

About The Business Year
The Business Year is a global media group that has been providing investors, businesses, and governments with first-hand insights into the world's most dynamic markets for over a decade. We conduct hundreds of interviews a week with top decision makers in the Middle East, Latin America, Central and Southeast Asia, Africa, and Europe. Our content is available in printed reports and across an array of digital platforms.
